strategy: Replace the gradient-boosted tree model with a neural network architecture featuring dense layers with batch normalization and dropout regularization. Introduce polynomial features up to degree 2 for continuous variables (e.g., age, fare) and one-hot encode categorical variables with a maximum cardinality of 10, using recursive feature elimination to select top 20 features. Apply class weighting during training based on the inverse frequency of survival classes, and use stratified k-fold cross-validation with a validation set derived from time-based splits (since the data is historical). This approach leverages non-linear interactions and adaptive learning that trees may miss.

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, StratifiedKFold
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, PolynomialFeatures
from sklearn.feature_selection import RFE
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop irrelevant columns
train_df = train_df.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)
test_df = test_df.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
train_df['Fare'].fillna(train_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
numerical_columns = ['Age', 'Fare', 'Pclass', 'SibSp', 'Parch']

# Create polynomial features (degree 2)
poly = PolynomialFeatures(degree=2, include_bias=False, interaction_only=False)

# Transform numerical features
X_num = train_df[numerical_columns]
X_num_test = test_df[numerical_columns]
X_num_poly = poly.fit_transform(X_num)
X_num_poly_test = poly.transform(X_num_test)

# One-hot encode categorical features (limit to max 10 categories)
encoder = OneHotEncoder(max_categories=10, drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore')
X_cat = train_df[categorical_columns]
X_cat_test = test_df[categorical_columns]
X_cat_encoded = encoder.fit_transform(X_cat)
X_cat_encoded_test = encoder.transform(X_cat_test)

# Combine numerical and categorical features
X_combined = np.hstack([X_num_poly, X_cat_encoded.toarray()])
X_combined_test = np.hstack([X_num_poly_test, X_cat_encoded_test.toarray()])

# Select top 20 features usi
